metadata.title: CVE-2022-2119 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
OFFIS DCMTK's (All versions prior to 3.6.7) service class provider (SCP) is vulnerable to path traversal, allowing an attacker to write DICOM files into arbitrary directories under controlled names. This could allow remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2119` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dcmtk - 3.6.7-6
libdcmtk17 - 3.6.7-6
No subscription required

notes.note: alexmurray> The patch for this CVE also includes CVE-2022-2120

criterions.comment: dcmtk package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.7-6').
